articles.headline: Fed to Publish a Forecast of Rate Moves, Guiding Investors
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve will publish the opinions of its governors and 12 regional presidents in an effort to help guide investors. The initial issue is to be released on Jan. 25.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve will publish the opinions of its governors and 12 regional presidents in an effort to help guide investors. The initial issue is to be released on Jan. 25.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve will begin later this month to publish the predictions of its senior officials about their own decisions, hoping to increase its influence over economic activity by guiding investor expectations.

articles.headline: Analysts See Performance Issues Behind RIM’s Delays
articles.snippet: Some analysts said Research in Motion’s delay of a new line of phones and a BlackBerry operating system was caused by poor performance, not the need for new chips.
articles.abstract: Some analysts said Research in Motion’s delay of a new line of phones and a BlackBerry operating system was caused by poor performance, not the need for new chips.
articles.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA — When Research in Motion said in December that a new line of BlackBerry phones would not appear until the end of 2012, the announcement provoked equal parts of shock and disbelief from analysts.

articles.headline: The Casino the State Saved
articles.snippet: Revel, a $2.4 billion casino, is scheduled to open in May with help from New Jersey. Supporters hope it will help spur a new era in Atlantic City, but critics say it may hurt an already fading market.
articles.abstract: Revel, a $2.4 billion casino, is scheduled to open in May with help from New Jersey. Supporters hope it will help spur a new era in Atlantic City, but critics say it may hurt an already fading market.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTIC CITY — The view from the 39th floor of the Revel resort and casino here is nearly as stunning as the fact that the $2.4 billion project is actually nearing completion after five years, including a stretch when construction halted for almost a year after financing evaporated.

articles.headline: Overtures to Egypt’s Islamists Reverse Longtime U.S. Policy
articles.snippet: With the Muslim Brotherhood in reach of an outright majority in Egypt’s parliament, the Obama administration has begun to shift from decades of hostility toward it.
articles.abstract: With the Muslim Brotherhood in reach of an outright majority in Egypt’s parliament, the Obama administration has begun to shift from decades of hostility toward it.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — With the Muslim Brotherhood pulling within reach of an outright majority in Egypt’s new Parliament, the Obama administration has begun to reverse decades of mistrust and hostility as it seeks to forge closer ties with an organization once viewed as irreconcilably opposed to United States interests.
articles.byline: By David D. Kirkpatrick and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: Teachers Resist High-Tech Push in Idaho Schools
articles.snippet: Teachers in Idaho and elsewhere have been in revolt over policy makers thrusting technology into classrooms and shifting money to unproven teaching methods.
articles.abstract: Teachers in Idaho and elsewhere have been in revolt over policy makers thrusting technology into classrooms and shifting money to unproven teaching methods.
articles.lead_paragraph: POST FALLS, Idaho — Ann Rosenbaum, a former military police officer in the Marines, does not shrink from a fight, having even survived a close encounter with a car bomb in Iraq. Her latest conflict is quite different: she is now a high school teacher, and she and many of her peers in Idaho are resisting a statewide plan that dictates how computers should be used in classrooms.

articles.headline: Romney Wins Iowa Caucus by 8 Votes
articles.snippet: In the first Republican contest of the season, the top two candidates were separated by only a sliver of votes, offering Rick Santorum a chance to emerge as the alternative to Mitt Romney.
articles.abstract: In the first Republican contest of the season, the top two candidates were separated by only a sliver of votes, offering Rick Santorum a chance to emerge as the alternative to Mitt Romney.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — Mitt Romney’s quest to swiftly lock down the Republican presidential nomination with a commanding finish in the Iowa caucuses was undercut on Tuesday night by the surging candidacy of Rick Santorum, who fought him to a draw on a shoestring budget by winning over conservatives who remain skeptical of Mr. Romney.

articles.headline: Online Sales Buoy U.P.S. And FedEx
articles.snippet: United Parcel Service and FedEx, the two major package delivery companies, have benefited as free shipping and returns have become more common among online retailers.
articles.abstract: United Parcel Service and FedEx, the two major package delivery companies, have benefited as free shipping and returns have become more common among online retailers.
articles.lead_paragraph: With sales rising to a record $35.3 billion in November and December — a 15 percent increase from a year ago, according to the research service comScore — online retailers are celebrating.

articles.headline: First Vote Reinforces G.O.P.’s Ideological Divide
articles.snippet: There are now two Republicans playing Someone Else against Mitt Romney.
articles.abstract: There are now two Republicans playing Someone Else against Mitt Romney.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — All year long the story of the Republican race for president was Mitt Romney and a rotating cast playing the role of Someone Else. On Tuesday night, Someone Else was played by two candidates: Rick Santorum, the longtime champion of social conservative issues that were supposedly taking a backseat in this jobs-centric presidential race, and Ron Paul, the noninterventionist Texan who represents an almost 180-degree turn from the Republican Party’s direction.

articles.headline: Yahoo’s Renovator in Chief
articles.snippet: Scott Thompson, PayPal’s president, will try to revamp Yahoo, the struggling online media company. He succeeds Carol Bartz, who was dismissed in September.
articles.abstract: Scott Thompson, PayPal’s president, will try to revamp Yahoo, the struggling online media company. He succeeds Carol Bartz, who was dismissed in September.
articles.lead_paragraph: Yahoo has chosen its Mr. Fix-It.

articles.headline: Good Year for Autos, but a Test Waits in ’12
articles.snippet: The Detroit carmakers posted double-digit increases in sales for the year as December finished with a flourish.
articles.abstract: The Detroit carmakers posted double-digit increases in sales for the year as December finished with a flourish.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — American automakers last year posted their best sales since the financial crisis, earning healthy profits from better products amid a steady increase in demand for new cars.
